00034 /** @file llvmutil.h
00035     @brief Header file with declarations for various LLVM utility stuff
00036 */
00037 
00038 #ifndef ISPC_LLVMUTIL_H
00039 #define ISPC_LLVMUTIL_H 1
00040 
00041 #include "ispc.h"
00042 #include <llvm/LLVMContext.h>
00043 #include <llvm/Type.h>
00044 #include <llvm/DerivedTypes.h>
00045 #include <llvm/Constants.h>
00046 
00047 
00048 /** This structure holds pointers to a variety of LLVM types; code
00049     elsewhere can use them from here, ratherthan needing to make more
00050     verbose LLVM API calls.
00051  */ 
00052 struct LLVMTypes {
00053     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *VoidType;
00054     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType *VoidPointerType;
00055     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *BoolType;
00056     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *Int8Type;
00057     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *Int16Type;
00058     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *Int32Type;
00059     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *Int32PointerType;
00060     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *Int64Type;
00061     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *Int64PointerType;
00062     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *FloatType;
00063     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *FloatPointerType;
00064     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *DoubleType;
00065     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *DoublePointerType;
00066 
00067     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *MaskType;
00068     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *BoolVectorType;
00069     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *Int1VectorType;
00070     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *Int32VectorType;
00071     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *Int32VectorPointerType;
00072     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *Int64VectorType;
00073     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *Int64VectorPointerType;
00074     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *FloatVectorType;
00075     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *FloatVectorPointerType;
00076     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *DoubleVectorType;
00077     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *DoubleVectorPointerType;
00078     static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *VoidPointerVectorType;
00079 };
00080 
00081 /** These variables hold the corresponding LLVM constant values as a
00082     convenience to code elsewhere in the system.
00083  */
00084 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMTrue, *LLVMFalse;
00085 
00086 /** This should be called early in initialization to initialize the members
00087     of LLVMTypes and the LLVMTrue/LLVMFalse constants.  However, it can't
00088     be called until the compilation target is known.
00089  */
00090 extern void InitLLVMUtil(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx, Target target);
00091 
00092 /** Returns an LLVM i32 constant of the given value */
00093 extern llvm::ConstantInt *LLVMInt32(int32_t i);
00094 /** Returns an LLVM i32 constant of the given value */
00095 extern llvm::ConstantInt *LLVMUInt32(uint32_t i);
00096 /** Returns an LLVM i64 constant of the given value */
00097 extern llvm::ConstantInt *LLVMInt64(int64_t i);
00098 /** Returns an LLVM i64 constant of the given value */
00099 extern llvm::ConstantInt *LLVMUInt64(uint64_t i);
00100 /** Returns an LLVM float constant of the given value */
00101 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMFloat(float f);
00102 /** Returns an LLVM double constant of the given value */
00103 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMDouble(double f);
00104 
00105 /** Returns an LLVM boolean vector constant of the given value smeared
00106     across all elements */
00107 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMBoolVector(bool v);
00108 /** Returns an LLVM i32 vector constant of the given value smeared
00109     across all elements */
00110 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMInt32Vector(int32_t i);
00111 /** Returns an LLVM i32 vector constant of the given value smeared
00112     across all elements */
00113 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMUInt32Vector(uint32_t i);
00114 /** Returns an LLVM i64 vector constant of the given value smeared
00115     across all elements */
00116 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMInt64Vector(int64_t i);
00117 /** Returns an LLVM i64 vector constant of the given value smeared
00118     across all elements */
00119 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMUInt64Vector(uint64_t i);
00120 /** Returns an LLVM float vector constant of the given value smeared
00121     across all elements */
00122 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMFloatVector(float f);
00123 /** Returns an LLVM double vector constant of the given value smeared
00124     across all elements */
00125 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMDoubleVector(double f);
00126 
00127 /** Returns an LLVM boolean vector based on the given array of values.
00128     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00129 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMBoolVector(const bool *v);
00130 /** Returns an LLVM i32 vector based on the given array of values.
00131     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00132 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMInt32Vector(const int32_t *i);
00133 /** Returns an LLVM i32 vector based on the given array of values.
00134     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00135 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMUInt32Vector(const uint32_t *i);
00136 /** Returns an LLVM i64 vector based on the given array of values.
00137     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00138 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMInt64Vector(const int64_t *i);
00139 /** Returns an LLVM i64 vector based on the given array of values.
00140     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00141 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMUInt64Vector(const uint64_t *i);
00142 /** Returns an LLVM float vector based on the given array of values.
00143     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00144 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMFloatVector(const float *f);
00145 /** Returns an LLVM double vector based on the given array of values.
00146     The array should have g->target.vectorWidth elements. */
00147 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMDoubleVector(const double *f);
00148 
00149 /** LLVM constant value representing an 'all on' SIMD lane mask */
00150 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMMaskAllOn;
00151 /** LLVM constant value representing an 'all off' SIMD lane mask */
00152 extern llvm::Constant *LLVMMaskAllOff;
00153 
00154 /** Given an LLVM type, returns the corresponding type for a vector of
00155     pointers to that type.  (In practice, an array of pointers, since LLVM
00156     prohibits vectors of pointers.
00157  */
00158 extern const llvm::ArrayType *LLVMPointerVectorType(const llvm::Type *t);
00159 
00160 #endif // ISPC_LLVMUTIL_H
